intro: Prestonia amanuensis, commonly known as the Jamaican star apple, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range from white to pink in color. Its fruit is a fleshy, star-shaped berry that contains several seeds. The botanical features of Prestonia amanuensis make it a distinctive and visually appealing species within its native habitat.
